intro: Tuberaria variabilis f. cavanillesii, commonly known as the Cavanillesii form of the variable tuberaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Crambe. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is native to the Iberian Peninsula. Its foliage consists of hairy, alternate leaves that are often glandular-dotted. This form is considered a variant of Tuberaria variabilis, distinguished by specific morphological traits.
